cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest across the central Gulf, then turn WNW toward the north-western Gulf coast (Louisiana) early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico (Yucatán Peninsula)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: eastern Yucatán today, central Gulf Sunday, north-western Gulf coast (mainly Louisiana and Mississippi) Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeast winds may reach gale force (34-kt) Tuesday night into Wednesday with a 28% cumulative chance and peak probabilities around 120 h.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor surge (1–2 ft) possible in Galveston Bay if Marco tracks farther west; significant surge (>3 ft) is not expected at Houston.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals if the track shifts west, causing brief flash-flood concerns in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights in the approaches to Houston Ship Channel beginning late Monday, posing restrictions for pilotage and cargo operations.
